additional.p: Two dates appear on this document. The later date of March 10th 1784 has been used for the purpose of dating the letter.

div.p:
Mr. Denman having called on me this morning informed of an Opportunity of conveying a small Parcel to you, so in a hurry accept thereof in transmitting you a few Portraits & Views, having noted down thereon the names of the Persons caractd.
caricatured from the Letter K you will please know are etched by one Kay a Barber & Wigmaker here, who has ushered into the place a variety of similar Objects commonly stalking about our Streets; unseen by you — when here, which I omitted to send, but should You be pleased with these Specimens, be pleased to hint & I will after wards send you every one of them his first Essays, he seems to be ashamed of, since his operations are noticed. —

The other DG is a young Lad David Gibson a Portrait Painter most in Minature a disciple of an ingenious tho' careless young Man
John Brown a most excellent designer & an uncommon elegant executor in the Black lead miniature line that has appeared here, who after a ten years residence in Italy &c. passes the time in this place not suitable to his merit, altho' requests from London has been repeatedly various, having often promised to agree yet postpones it untill at last his scanty income may compell his departure, being realy a Genius he will not labour but
when the fancy invites. — These are Gibson's first Essays.

As to my friend Mr. Cardonnel who draws well, within these few weeks, for Amusement at a leisure hour, has taken a fancy for Etching, these are his first attempts so leave them submissely to yourself & beg to have your Sentiments, the plates of our Scottish Coins are of his Execution, those of our William are of a late discovered Treasure since you was here, found at the Burial place of the Family of Brodie Parish of Dyke Morayshire, few of which, alas! as I can learn were preserved from the melting pot, but these two varieties vizt.
Roceburg
i.e Roxburgh and Pert or Perth, which indicate them to be of Scottish mintage, unnoticed by every Collictor, Writer &Ca. on that Subject before that has fal'n into my hands or ever before known to any one I've conversed with since the discovery: I must confess it happened to be my Lot to obtain on of these Roxburgh Coins from Orkney two or three years ago, to which place these had been carried by some Pedlars; it is the more remarkable the Reverse differs from all our Scottish Coinage prior to later, so cannot account for this alteration: pray oblige me with your Sentiments on this point: I cannot observe any similar British &Ca. Coinage but in
Ducarel's Norman Coins 4to.
but is imperfete, & inserted in his Norman Coins fig. 1. plate 1. — Mr. Cardonnel has some thoughts of Etching a series of our Silver Scottish Mintage See Cardonnel's 1786
Numismata Scotiæ, or a series of the Scottish coinage, from the reign of William the Lion to the Union . & that more completely arranged than has yet been done, it will be a work of time, if you have an varieties or know of such it would be very kind to communicate drawings of such at Convenience, especially such as are not in Andersons Diplom. & Numismata Scotiæ or Snelling's Silver Coins , these two we have & are the most capital Collection ever arrange yet are both imperfete as many late discoveries convince us. What is your opinion of such a design: Mr. Cardonnel is one of the Secretary's Clerks in the Custom house here. — Among them you will find two drawings of the Isle or Rock Bass from Slezer , am sorry do not please me but are justly enough copied, Mr. Runciman has been so bad this Winter which has disqualified him from working any & am affraid is in a very delicate state promising not long life, if he finishes his Sketch you shall get one.

The late Demands from Parliament for Accounts for these four Months past have exercised every moment I had, this with the dread of it's dissolution every post deterred me from writing you, else would have not been so long silent: Mr. Low is expected up here from Orkney later end of May or beginning of June, so suppose giving me a positive Answer about his
Tour &ca
till we meet, of which you shall be informed how soon any thing is fixed.
I shall rejoice in having every opportunity of serving you so await your instructions being

closer.salute:
Dr Sir
Your most obedient Servant
